intro: Hieracium caesium subsp. latitegulatum, commonly known as the yellow hawkweed, is a perennial flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its bright yellow flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, preferring full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a hairy texture, while its stems are upright and branched. The subspecies latitegulatum is distinguished by its broader leaf bases and more robust growth compared to other members of the species.
